plugins.name: VariableMaster - Swap Variables
plugins.description:
VariableMaster - Master all your variable workflows


Variable Master is your complete variable workflow solution for Figma. Switch variables between any libraries - local to published, published to local, or between different files. Whether you're swapping collections within the same file or moving components from one library to another, Variable Master makes it simple and fast.


Features :


- Swap variables between local and published libraries

- Switch collections between local variables

- Switch component variables from library A to library B easily

- Work with current selection, page, or entire file

- See what will change before you apply it

- Handle thousands of variables at once

- Pick which collections to swap or exclude specific variables


How to use :


1. Choose what to update (selection, page, or file) and pick your libraries from the drop down.

2. Select which collections to swap and see the preview.

3. Uncheck variables you don't want to change, then click on swap variables.


Ps : plugin picks libraries only if they are added in the File. You can add them to you file via Asset panel.


RoadMap :


- Find all variables used in your designs

- Export and import variable collections

- Check for design elements that need variables‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã


This Plugin is completely free to use, No charges for swapping variables.
plugins.tagline: Master all your variable workflows

plugins.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
plugins.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

Hot sauce on everything.

plugins.name: Text Styles to Variables
plugins.description:
PLUGIN CRAFTED FOR REFOKUS


Plugin Documentation

This plugin extracts font-related properties from your local text styles and converts them into reusable variables. It automatically applies the following variables:

‚Ä¢Font size

‚Ä¢Font weight

‚Ä¢Font family


Additionally, the plugin documents‚Äîbut does not apply‚Äîthe following properties:

‚Ä¢Line height

‚Ä¢Letter spacing


This is due to a current Figma limitation: dynamic variables for these properties are not yet supported. As a workaround, these values are stored as string variables for documentation purposes only.


For example:

If the original line-height is 100%, the plugin will store it as a variable with:

variableName: 100%, variableValue: 1em (calculated as 100 √∑ 100 √ó 1em)


Naming Convention for text styles:


To ensure accurate detection and conversion, your text styles should follow this naming structure:

‚Ä¢Use the prefix title- followed by a number (e.g., title-1) for headings

‚Ä¢Use the prefix text- followed by a number (e.g., text-2) for paragraphs


You can also use suffixes to describe combo classes. For instance:

‚Ä¢text-2-buttonLabel


This will still be recognized as a text-2 style with additional contextual information.
plugins.tagline: By Fede Luna

plugins.name: Stockpress
plugins.description:
About

Welcome to the Stockpress plugin for Figma, where you can quickly find and add files from your Stockpress workspace to your Figma designs. Once ready, export Frames and images back to Stockpress - complete with Frame URLs for easy access to working files!


What is Stockpress?

Stockpress is a refreshingly simple Digital Asset Management system‚Äìfor everyone. One centralized workspace to add, organize, collaborate on, and share files with unlimited users and teams.


How to get started:

  1. First, sign up for a Stockpress workspace (get started for free!)
  2. Upload or import your files and folders to get organized
  3. Install the Stockpress plugin for Figma and connect your account
  4. Easily add files from Stockpress to your Figma designs
  5. Export Frames, images, and/or Frame URLs back to Stockpress


For help, contact us through your in-workspace chat or email us at help@stockpress.co
plugins.tagline: Add files from your Stockpress workspace to your design and export Figma assets back once ready

plugins.name: Font Theme
plugins.description:
Not all fonts that go well together match the theme of your design. This AI powered plugin lets you describe your design and its intended audience and then suggests font pairs that match the theme you entered. You can also simply just type in the vibe or feeling you want the font to evoke.


The best part? You can save the fonts and all their weights as text styles in your Figma with the click of a button!


The text styles will save the font weights as numbers because that's how developers code font weights. This will ease the communication with your developers because you'll get familiar with how they refer to font weights.
plugins.tagline: Search for font pairs to match the feeling of your design.

plugins.name: Adtraction Table Generator
plugins.description:
A specialized Figma plugin designed exclusively for Adtraction employees to streamline the process of converting complex Excel reports into presentation-ready Figma tables.


Key Features:

  1. üìä Automatically splits large Excel files into separate tables
  2. üéØ Purpose-built for Adtraction's reporting structure:
  3. Koncern (Group) tables
  4. Moderbolag (Parent company) tables
  5. Other financial data tables
  6. üé® Maintains Adtraction's brand typography with Lexend font
  7. üîç Preview tables before generation
  8. ‚ö°Ô∏è Bulk processing of multiple tables from a single Excel file
  9. üîí Local processing for data security


Perfect Use Case:

Designed specifically for Adtraction's quarterly and annual financial reporting workflow. When you have one large Excel file containing multiple tables of financial data, this plugin automatically:

  1. Identifies different table sections
  2. Splits them into separate tables
  3. Applies appropriate styling based on table type (koncern/moderbolag)
  4. Generates all tables with consistent formatting


Ideal for:

  1. Adtraction financial team members
  2. Corporate communications staff
  3. Anyone working with Adtraction's financial reports in Figma

This is a niche tool optimized for Adtraction's specific needs, making the process of converting financial Excel data into presentation-ready Figma tables quick and consistent.


Note: This plugin is primarily intended for Adtraction employees and is optimized for their internal Excel report format and brand guidelines.
plugins.tagline: Transform Adtraction Excel reports into perfectly formatted Figma tables  ‚ú®

plugins.name: Figma Variable to Code
plugins.description:
This plugin was created to keep Figma variables in sync with variables in the codebase.


For example, you can quickly generate a sass variable for each of the color variables in your Figma file. This ensures your variables in the codebase have the same value and name as the variables in the Figma file.


  1. Load the variable collections
  2. Choose the collection you want to generate variables for
  3. Paste the format you want variable data to be generated in, and replace static content with the dynamic keys in the formatting list
  4. Click generate
  5. Copy the generated variables and put them in the appropriate file in your codebase


Note: If a collection contains groups of variables, each variable from each group is treated as its own unique variable.
plugins.tagline: Format data from Figma variable collections into the syntax you need for your codebase.

plugins.name: Jam Session
plugins.description:
Jam Session lets you run inclusive activities in FigJam.

Start a session as a facilitator and let anybody join by sharing a QR code, unique link or session code. Take control of hybrid or in-person workshop facilities and make sure everyone can inclusively participate.


Learn more at www.jamsesh.xyz


How to use

  1. Start a session with the plugin. Set a timer, an activity prompt, and how you want notes to appear on the board.
  2. Share the QR code or a link with participants. Anybody can join your session on any device through our companion web-app.
  3. Watch submissions roll in. Wait until the timer finishes or end the session early. Affinity map, synth or destroy the results as you please.


Whether you're running an in-person workshop with a FigJam board as the source of truth, or doing something hybrid and just want to ensure everyone can contribute, Jam Session is the tool you never knew you needed.

  1. Keeps the fun alive in workshops
  2. Avoids firewall or laggy machine issues for diverse participants
  3. Gives you control of how submissions appear


Jam Session is in public beta.

A FigJam plugin with this many moving parts may have rough edges. If you find something weird or didn't work, please don't hesitate to reach out to the support email and we'll get right on it.

accepted.name: dano
accepted.description: i do design and design activities

plugins.tagline: Join FigJam activities from anywhere! Run sessions anybody can join from any device.

plugins.name: Modyo Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
The Modyo Figma Plugin is an essential tool for designers working within the Dynamic Framework. This plugin streamlines your design-to-development workflow with three core functionalities:


Export CSS as Variables: Seamlessly export your design elements as CSS variables tailored for the Dynamic Framework. This feature ensures consistency and speeds up the handoff process, making it easier for developers to implement designs directly from Figma.


Generate Color Palette: Effortlessly create and customize color palettes directly within Figma. This feature allows you to generate a range of colors that can be easily adjusted and applied across your design system, ensuring brand consistency and flexibility.


Font Size Generator Based on PX: Simplify your typography management with a font size generator that operates based on pixel values. This allows for easy creation of a typographic scale that aligns with your design requirements, ensuring responsive and visually appealing text styles.


The Modyo Figma Plugin is designed to empower designers and developers, making collaboration smoother and more efficient by providing a unified toolkit for creating consistent and high-quality UI components.
plugins.tagline: A plugin for Dynamic Framework

plugins.name: Easy Select
plugins.description:
Easy Select helps you expedite the tedious and repetitive selection workflows with handy 1-click shortcuts.


-> Simply select one item, then:

  1. Select its parent / children / siblings
  2. Select others with the same color, name, size, rotation ...


-> Or, select a few items, then:

  1. Filter down to those with a particular type, name...


-> Save your carefully curated selections as bookmarks for reuse.


-> Restore from a list of historical selections.


For questions or feedback, please email easy-select@smarter.town.
plugins.tagline: The all-in-one selection helper

plugins.name: Variable Remapper
plugins.description:
OVERVIEW


The Variable Remapper is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline design system management by enabling seamless migration and remapping of variables between different libraries and collections. This tool is essential for teams managing complex design systems, migrating between libraries, or consolidating variable usage across projects.


CORE CAPABILITIES


Variable Remapping

The plugin provides comprehensive bulk variable migration capabilities, automatically remapping variables from one library to another across entire design systems. The intelligent name matching system matches variables between source and target libraries based on name similarity, reducing manual configuration requirements.

Users can exercise precise scope control by choosing to remap variables across selected objects only, the current page, or all pages in the document. Additionally, collection-specific remapping allows filtering to specific variable collections for granular control over migration processes.


Variable Analysis and Mapping

The system offers comprehensive variable listing functionality to scan and catalog all variable bindings throughout designs. The detailed view presents every variable binding with complete contextual information, including node names and types, bound properties such as fills, strokes, effects, and dimensions, current variable names and sources, plus complete library and collection information.

The grouped view consolidates similar variable bindings for streamlined bulk management operations, while the interactive mapping table enables manual specification of target variables for precise control over remapping processes.


Library Management

The plugin provides robust multi-library support, working seamlessly with local variables in current files, team library variables, and remote libraries. Automatic library detection identifies variable sources and displays comprehensive library information throughout the interface.

Users can browse through variable collections with detailed counts and metadata, supported by real-time loading of library collections and variables for immediate access to current information.


KEY FEATURES


Precision Control

The plugin supports comprehensive property-level binding across all Figma variable binding types, including color variables for fills and strokes, dimension variables for width, height, corner radius, and stroke weight, effect variables for opacity, rotation, and positioning, and boolean variables for visibility controls.

Advanced array property support handles complex bindings such as multiple fills or effects, while safe remapping functionality validates target variables before applying changes to ensure data integrity throughout the migration process.


Advanced Analysis

The binding discovery system automatically identifies all variable bindings across complex node hierarchies, providing complete visibility into variable usage patterns. Source attribution functionality shows exactly where each variable originates, whether from the current file, specific team library names, or remote libraries.

Collection context displays variable collection names for improved organization and understanding of variable relationships throughout the design system.


User Experience

The tabbed interface provides clean separation between remapping and analysis functions, enabling focused workflows for different use cases. Real-time feedback includes loading states, progress indicators, and detailed status messages to keep users informed throughout operations.

Comprehensive error handling delivers actionable feedback when issues arise, while the modern user interface utilizes Figma-native styling with responsive design principles for seamless integration with existing workflows.


USE CASES


Design System Migration

Organizations can migrate from deprecated variable libraries to updated versions, consolidate multiple libraries into a single source of truth, and update variable references when reorganizing design systems. This capability is essential for maintaining consistency during design system evolution and reducing technical debt.


Theme Management

Teams can efficiently switch between light and dark theme variables, apply brand-specific variable sets across different product lines, and test various variable configurations during design exploration phases. This functionality supports rapid iteration and brand consistency maintenance.


Cleanup and Optimization

The plugin enables identification of unused or orphaned variable bindings, standardization of variable usage across teams, and comprehensive auditing of variable implementation across large-scale projects. These capabilities support design system hygiene and optimization efforts.


Workflow Automation

Organizations can batch update variable references during design system updates, streamline handoff processes between design and development teams, and maintain consistency across multiple Figma files. This automation reduces manual work and minimizes human error in variable management processes.
plugins.tagline: Streamline design system by bulk remapping variables across libraries, pages, and components.

plugins.name: Data Bloom
plugins.description:
Data Bloom is your go-to plugin for breathing life into your Figma designs. Easily replace generic dummy text with real-looking, localized content and user data tailored to your audience. Now supporting 10 languages with 10+ data type options (see below), Data Bloom will continue expanding to include more languages and data types.


Supported languages:

üá¶üáø Azerbaijani, üá∫üá∏ English (USA), üá©üá™ German, üá∞üáø Kazakh, üá∞üá¨ Kyrgyz, üá∑üá∫ Russian, üáπüá∑ Turkish, üáπüá≤ Turkmen, üá∫üá¶ Ukrainian, üá∫üáø Uzbek


Available data types:

üé≤ Random: Generates a data point by randomly selecting from any of the other available data types.

üë´üèª Names: Creates realistic first names, last names, or full names, with options for gender.

ü§™ Playful Usernames: Produces fun and quirky usernames, optionally starting with an "@" symbol.

üìû Phone Numbers: Generates phone numbers with various formatting options, including country-specific domestic styles.

üí≥ Payment card details: Helps to generate mock payment card information, such as Card numbers, Expiry date and CVV/CVC

‚≠êÔ∏è Ratings and reviews: Generate localized generic review text from categories like "General", "Product specific" or "App feedback"

üìÜ Date: Creates date values with customizable formats and selectable year ranges, including custom inputs.

üìÜ Days of the week: Inserts day names (e.g., Monday, Tuesday)

üìÜ Months: Populates layers with month names (e.g., January, February)

üíº Professions: Populates layers with a diverse list of job titles and occupations.

üé® Colors: Replaces selected text layers with common color names.


Whether you‚Äôre designing a prototype or building a demo, Data Bloom makes it effortless to populate text layers in seconds, ensuring your prototypes feel authentic, personalized, and polished.


‚ú¶ Lightning-fast generation

‚ú¶ Realistic, localized data (Names, Phone Numbers, Colors, Usernames and Professions)

‚ú¶ Lightweight and Figma-friendly

‚ú¶ Continuous updates with new languages and data types


Replace ‚Äúlorem ipsum‚Äù forever ‚Äî grow your designs with Data Bloom.


üå± How-to Guide:

  1. Run the Data Bloom plugin.
  2. Select one or multiple text layers in your design where you want to insert random data.
  3. Choose a preferred data language and data type from the list.
  4. Click ‚ÄúGenerate Data‚Äù and the plugin will instantly populate the selected text layers based on your set preferences.

plugins.name: SmartTableFill
plugins.description:
SmartTableFill is a GPT-powered plugin designed for intelligent table population with contextual data. Unlike basic data fillers, SmartTableFill analyzes existing content to generate relevant entries, making it ideal for tasks like: creating email addresses based on user names, generating addresses aligned with specified cities, or calculating percentages based on given numbers.


Choose between basic and contextual modes to quickly populate tables for mockups, prototyping, and presentations. Customizable settings allow you to target specific text nodes, saving time on manual entry and bringing a smarter approach to data generation.

plugins.name: Text With Styles
plugins.description:
# Flutter Text Style Inspector


A powerful Figma plugin that bridges the gap between Figma text styles and Flutter's Material Design text theme system. This plugin helps developers and designers maintain consistency between Figma designs and Flutter implementations by automatically mapping Figma text styles to their corresponding Flutter TextTheme properties.


## Features


### Real-time Style Inspection

- Instantly view text style information for any selected text layer

- Live updates as you select different text elements

- Support for multiple text selection with smart duplicate filtering


### Comprehensive Style Information

- Displays the complete Figma text style name

- Shows associated color token information

- Previews the actual text content

- Automatically generates corresponding Flutter TextTheme code


### Smart Flutter Code Generation

- Automatically maps Figma text styles to Flutter's Material Design text theme

- Supports all standard Material text styles:

- Headlines (Large, Medium, Small)

- Titles (Large, Medium, Small)

- Body text (with weight variations)

- Labels (Large, Medium, Small)

- Includes font weight handling for body styles (w400, w500, w600)


### User-Friendly Interface

- Clean, organized display of style information

- Easy-to-copy Flutter code snippets

- Compact, floating UI that stays out of your way

- Simple click-outside-to-close functionality


## How to Use


1. Select any text layer(s) in your Figma design

2. The plugin will automatically display:

- The applied Figma text style

- The color token (if available)

- A preview of the text content

- The equivalent Flutter TextTheme code

3. Copy the generated Flutter code directly into your application


## Best Practices


- Name your Figma text styles to match Material Design conventions for automatic mapping

- Use consistent style names to ensure accurate Flutter code generation

- Apply color styles to text layers for complete token information

- Select multiple text layers to quickly inspect all text styles in a component


Perfect for teams working with both Figma and Flutter, this plugin streamlines the handoff process and ensures design consistency across platforms.
plugins.tagline: Select any layer and get its texts with styles

plugins.name: Padding Check
plugins.description: Are developers always at your back since your paddings are always not multiples of 4? This plugin solves this problem of yours where you can quickly identify the Figma frames with the said padding issues. The plugin has a very simple UI where we have info display section and 2 buttons. 1st button "Highlight frames" selects all problematic frames and brings them to your view (Shift+1) and the 2nd button "Mark frames" creates a red box around all the frames that have a padding issue. The good news is that this plugin works only for Auto layout frames and not for all frames thereby not giving you unwanted results. As a helper once the plugin is executed (either of the buttons used to find the frames with issues) The information section of the plugin UI displays the count of the frames with issues helping the user to quickly take account of the issue.
plugins.tagline: Are all paddings in your Figma file multiples of 4? Use this plugin to quickly identify if not!

plugins.name: PRE: AI Design Review
plugins.description:
PRE helps designers and product teams understand how users will interact with their UI designs ‚Äî before a single line of code is written.


üîπ Select any frame in Figma and click ‚ÄúUpload Selected Frame‚Äù to send it to PRE.

üîπ PRE will automatically generate a heatmap, predict click-through rates, and provide UX suggestions using AI.

üîπ You can modify the generated tags, draw additional clickable elements, or toggle the heatmap overlay on and off using the second button in the top bar.

üîπ Once you're happy with the predictions, you can download the heatmap and click data for further analysis or presentation.


Whether you're working on early wireframes or high-fidelity mocks, PRE helps you make design decisions backed by predictive user analytics ‚Äî all from right inside Figma.


Powered by PRE
plugins.tagline: Export any Figma frame and instantly generate heatmaps, CTR predictions and UX feedback with PRE.

plugins.name: Set Gradient Style
plugins.description:
The plugin allows you to transfer the parameters of a new gradient to previously published styles, simplifying the process of manually transferring angles and breakpoints. This may be necessary if you need to update the current style, but doing it manually will cause.


  1. Select a Frame, Rectangle or Vector with a new gradient
  2. Write local style name which you want to update
  3. Press "Set style"

plugins.name: Notes
plugins.description:
Notes is a Figma plugin designed to streamline collaboration between designers, project managers, and engineers. It enhances the design handoff process by providing a structured way to document and share feedback directly within Figma. Whether you're annotating designs, adding development notes, or organizing project details, Notes ensures seamless communication and clarity across teams.

With Notes, design handoff becomes more efficient, reducing miscommunication and making it easier for teams to align on project goals.
